An interactive Cutscene galore with an annoying character "Oh gawd Ghordon, we gotta keep movin' Goredon..." the game's a lot shorter than the other HL2 games, it had a few cool moments and the game can get pretty decent when you're left alone to experience it for yourself. But that can only take a lacklustre episode so far.

A short installment to the classic series. Of course it's a must play.

best half life game

much better than hl1
Simplemente, si te gusto Half Life 2 y quedaste con ganas de mas, juegalo.

If you want to play through the series then you need to play this one.  It's also good to have for mods so just buy it, you can get it dirt cheap during a sale.

Episode 1 is probably the black sheep of the mainline Half-Life games not because it's bad (it isn't bad at all), but because it doesn't do a whole lot either.  Whereas Episode 2 was more of Half-Life 2 and did a lot more things with it, Episode 1 is basically just more Half-Life 2 in terms of gameplay and not much else.  Episode 2 built upon Half-Life 2, Episode 1 is more of the same.  There's a new zombie variant, some story, and that's pretty much it.  Most of Episode 1 is you and Alyx traversing through City 17 while fighting enemies along the way.  At most Episode 1 exists to keep pedaling the story along from Half-Life 2 to Episode 2, Episode 1 really serves to bridge the gap in between.  It's not outstanding by any means although it's still a good game, and it's a requirement when playing through Gordon Freeman's adventures.  Yeah, do get this game, just don't expect it to be as spectacular or different like Episode 2.
This game very much reminds me of the times I had before the accident.
